summary: Feature request to extend ServiceClient::createSSL() to accept client certificates and allow server name override using gRPC options (grpc.default_authority and grpc.ssl_target_name_override).
userImpact: Users cannot configure mutual TLS with client certificates or override the server name for gRPC connections, limiting secure communication options.
rootCause: ServiceClient::createSSL() method lacks parameters for client certificate paths and gRPC channel options for server name override.
proposedFix: Extend ServiceClient::createSSL() signature to accept client certificate paths and additional gRPC options like grpc.default_authority and grpc.ssl_target_name_override.
resolutionDetails: The method was extended to support client certificates and gRPC options for server name configuration.
keyQuote: But there is no way to provide client certs and override server name with `grpc.default_authority` and `grpc.ssl_target_name_override`.
